name: Math Land
description:
An IDN (Interactive Digital Narrative) is a digital form of storytelling where a user can interact within the story itself.

The researchers would like to create an interactive Digital Narrative that will primarily be used as a tool for teachers to use, so that the level of connectivity and bond between the teachers and students will be enhanced, which traditional IDN currently lacks.

From that, The researchers would like to get your input on your suggestions to make the IDN suited for the needs of the preschool teachers, and the visual, music and gameplay design that the researchers must take to make it an appropriate software for preschool teachers to use.

==========

• An interactive animated storybook about the world of Math from numbers 1-5.

• Presented in a lively, non-denomination manner for children 3-7

KEY FEATURES:

• Engaging original music throughout the storybook

• All words are “active” for extended word play and language learning – tap on any word to hear it spoken

• Two modes: “Read The Story” and the fully interactive “Explore The Story”

==========

The game has two modes: "Read the Story" and "Explore The Story"

Read The Story - Allows the users to read the story and interact with the world, without the software reading it for you.

Explore The Story - In this mode, the software will automatically read the story for you, but as well allows the user to interact with the story.

==========

• Fully animated pages, with animated introductory pages

• Virtually every item on each page comes to life when tapped

• Multiple settings to further customize the software for your teaching-reading experience

• Parental tips to help you get the most out of this interactive storybook
